info.title: FHIR Condition resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns Conditions based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for Condition.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: asserter
parameters.description: Person who asserts this condition

parameters.name: body-site
parameters.description: Anatomical location, if relevant

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the condition

parameters.name: clinicalstatus
parameters.description: The clinical status of the condition

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Code for the condition

parameters.name: date-recorded
parameters.description: A date, when the Condition statement was documented. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Encounter when condition first asserted

parameters.name: evidence
parameters.description: Manifestation/symptom

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier of the condition record

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date related onsets (dateTime and Period). The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: onset-info
parameters.description: Other onsets (boolean, age, range, string)

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who has the condition?

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: The severity of the condition

parameters.name: stage
parameters.description: Simple summary (disease specific)

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing Condition based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

delete.description:
The conditional delete interaction allows a client to delete Condition/Conditions based on some selection criteria, rather than by a specific logical id.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of Conditions based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.
